page.title: 06One Man's Opinion
page.content: This quite shocking cold and wet summer has shown up Peterborough in the best possible light. There are so many aspects to the city since the expansion programme got under way that we've come to take them for granted - the roads, Queensgate, the leisure facilities, all the houses, the thousands of new jobs, Nene Park and all the rest of it. But as I drove back into the city after my holiday I was struck by the quite dazzling landscaping effect - helped by all the rain - which the Development Corpora- tion has achieved. All the trees and shrubs and flowers have really made the city a quite beautiful place to look at. And, of course, it will get better as the years roll by. The landscaping is a superb example of careful and thoughtful planning at its very best. {John Harper-Tee
